pork.name: Pork Adobo
procedure: Marinate the pork in soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaves, and peppercorns for at least 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a pot and sauté the onions and garlic until fragrant.
Add the pork and cook until browned.
Add the marinade, water, and bring to a boil.
Lower the heat and simmer for 40-50 minutes or until the meat is tender.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve with rice.

pork.name: Pork Sisig
ingredients: 500g pork belly (or face), boiled and chopped into small pieces
procedure: Boil the pork belly or pork face until tender. Drain and chop into small pieces.
Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onions and chilies until softened.
Add the chopped pork, soy sauce, vinegar, and calamansi juice.
Stir well and cook for a few minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
If you like it creamy, add mayonnaise and stir.
Serve the sisig on a sizzling plate and top with a raw egg (optional).
Serve with steamed rice.

pork.name: Pork Menudo
ingredients: 1/2 cup pork liver, cut into cubes
procedure: Heat oil in a pot and sauté the garlic, onions, and tomatoes until soft.
Add the pork and cook until it turns brown.
Add the pork liver and cook for 5 minutes.
Add the soy sauce, tomato sauce, and water. Stir well and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the potatoes, carrots, bell peppers, and green peas. Continue cooking until vegetables are tender.
Season with salt, pepper, and raisins.
Simmer for an additional 10 minutes before serving.

pork.name: Lechon Kawali
procedure: Boil the pork belly in a pot of water with onion, garlic, bay leaves, peppercorns, and salt.
Boil for about 45 minutes or until tender.
Let the pork belly cool, then pat dry.
Heat oil in a deep pan and fry the pork belly until golden and crispy.
Slice the pork into bite-sized pieces and serve with dipping sauce.

pork.name: Pork Nilaga
ingredients: 500g pork (preferably pork belly or bone-in cuts)
1 corn on the cob, cut into pieces
procedure: In a large pot, combine pork, onion, garlic, and enough water to cover the meat.
Boil for 1-1.5 hours until the pork is tender.
Add potatoes and corn, and cook for another 10-15 minutes.
Add the string beans and pechay. Simmer for another 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper, and serve.

pork.name: Pork Dinuguan
ingredients: 500g pork (liver, heart, or belly), cut into chunks
1 cup pork blood (available in Asian markets)
procedure: Heat oil in a pot and sauté the garlic, onions, and chilies until fragrant.
Add the pork and cook until browned.
Pour in the vinegar and let it simmer for 5 minutes to cook off the vinegar.
Add the pork blood and water or broth. Stir gently to combine.
Simmer for 30-40 minutes or until the pork is tender.
Season with salt and pepper, and serve hot.

pork.name: Bicol Express
procedure: Heat oil in a pan and sauté garlic, onions, and chilies until softened.
Add the pork and cook until lightly browned.
Stir in shrimp paste and cook for another 2 minutes.
Pour in the coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
Cook for 10-15 minutes until the sauce thickens and the pork is tender.
Season with salt and pepper, then serve.

pork.name: Pork Binagoongan
procedure: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the garlic, onions, and tomatoes until softened.
Add the pork and cook until browned.
Stir in the bagoong alamang and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Pour in the vinegar and let it simmer without stirring for 5 minutes.
Add water and sugar, then mix well. Simmer until the pork is tender.
Toss in the green chilies and cook for another 2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper, then serve hot.

pork.name: Pork Caldereta
procedure: Heat oil in a pot and sauté the garlic and onions until fragrant.
Add the pork and cook until browned.
Pour in the tomato sauce and broth, then add the bay leaves.
Simmer until the pork is tender.
Mix in the liver spread and soy sauce, stirring until well combined.
Add the potatoes, carrots, and bell pepper. Cook until the vegetables are tender.
Toss in the green peas and cook for another 2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper, then serve hot.

pork.name: Pork Kare-kare
ingredients: 1 tablespoon annatto powder (achuete) dissolved in 1/4 cup water
1 bundle string beans, cut into 2-inch pieces
Bagoong alamang (fermented shrimp paste) for serving
procedure: Heat oil in a pot and sauté the garlic and onions until softened.
Add the pork and cook until browned.
Pour in the broth and bring to a boil. Simmer until the pork is tender.
Mix in the annatto water and peanut butter, stirring until the sauce thickens.
Add the eggplant, string beans, and banana blossom. Cook until the vegetables are tender.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with bagoong alamang on the side.

chicken.name: Chicken Adobo
ingredients: 1 kg chicken, cut into serving pieces
procedure: Combine the chicken, soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, onion, bay leaves, and peppercorns in a bowl. Marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a pot and sauté the garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add the chicken and cook until lightly browned.
Add the marinade, water, and bring to a boil.
Lower the heat and simmer for 40-50 minutes or until the chicken is tender and the sauce thickens.
Season with salt and pepper, and serve with rice.

chicken.name: Chicken Pochero
procedure: Heat oil in a pot and sauté the garlic, onion, and tomatoes until softened.
Add the chicken and cook until browned.
Pour in the broth or water and bring to a boil. Simmer until the chicken is tender.
Add the potatoes, carrots, and banana. Cook until the vegetables are tender.
Toss in the cabbage and pechay, then cook until just wilted.
Season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper. Serve hot.

chicken.name: Sinampalukang Manok
procedure: Boil chicken in water with onion, tomatoes, and lemongrass until the chicken is tender.
Add the tamarind leaves or tamarind paste, and cook for 5 minutes.
Add the potatoes and cook for 10 minutes, then add the string beans and cook until tender.
Add the pechay and long green chilies, and cook for another 3-5 minutes.
Season with salt and fish sauce to taste, then serve hot.

chicken.name: Tinolang Manok
procedure: In a pot, heat oil and sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until fragrant.
Add the chicken and cook until lightly browned.
Add water and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer for 30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
Add the papaya and string beans, cooking until the vegetables are tender.
Add the spinach or malunggay leaves and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper, and serve hot.

chicken.name: Pinoy Fried Chicken
procedure: Marinate the chicken in buttermilk, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, salt, and pepper for at least 30 minutes or overnight.
In a bowl, combine the flour and baking powder.
Coat each piece of chicken with the seasoned flour mixture.
Heat oil in a deep pan or fryer and fry the chicken until golden brown and cooked through (about 10-12 minutes).
Drain on paper towels, serve hot.

chicken.name: Chicken Afritada
ingredients: 1 kg chicken, cut into serving pieces
procedure: Heat oil in a pot and sauté garlic, onions, and tomatoes until soft.
Add the chicken and cook until browned.
Add the tomato sauce, chicken broth, carrots, and potatoes. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 20-25 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
Add the bell peppers and green peas, and cook for another 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper, and serve with rice.

chicken.name: Chicken Inasal
ingredients: 1 kg chicken, cut into parts (legs, thighs, breasts)
procedure: Combine soy sauce, vinegar, calamansi juice, sugar, garlic, ginger, lemongrass, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Marinate the chicken in this mixture for at least 30 minutes, or preferably overnight.
Preheat the grill or grill pan. If using banana leaves, wrap the chicken in the leaves for added flavor.
Grill the chicken, basting occasionally with the marinade, until the chicken is cooked through and golden brown.
Serve hot with rice and a dipping sauce (like vinegar with chili and garlic).

chicken.name: Pinikpikan
ingredients: Whole native chicken, cleaned and prepared
Etag (smoked and salted pork) or regular pork (optional)
procedure: Roast the chicken over an open flame until the skin is charred. Remove the burnt skin and cut the chicken into serving pieces.
In a pot, sauté the garlic, onion, and ginger until fragrant.
Add the chicken and cook until lightly browned.
Pour in the water or chicken broth and bring to a boil. Simmer until the chicken is tender.
If using etag or pork, add it to the pot and cook until tender.
Add the sayote or green papaya and cook until soft.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Garnish with spring onions or leeks and serve hot.

chicken.name: Bringhe
ingredients: 2 cups glutinous rice (malagkit), washed and drained
1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder (or atsuete for coloring)
procedure: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add the chicken and cook until browned.
Stir in the rice and turmeric powder, mixing well to coat the rice.
Pour in the coconut milk and broth, then bring to a boil. Reduce heat and let it simmer.
Add the bell pepper, carrot, and raisins. Cover and cook until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed.
Line a pan with banana leaves, then transfer the cooked rice into it. Flatten and cover with more banana leaves.
Cook over low heat until the bottom is slightly toasted. Serve warm.

chicken.name: Pininyahang Manok
ingredients: 1 cup evaporated milk or coconut milk
procedure: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the garlic and onion until softened.
Add the chicken and cook until browned.
Pour in the pineapple juice and let it simmer until the chicken is tender.
Add the pineapple chunks, carrots, and bell pepper. Cook until the vegetables are tender.
Stir in the evaporated milk and season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper.
Simmer until the sauce thickens. Serve hot.

fish.name: Paksiw na Galunggong
procedure: Arrange the fish in a pot. Add garlic, onion, and ginger.
Pour in vinegar and water. Season with salt and pepper.
Cover and simmer over low heat until fish is cooked and sauce is slightly reduced.
Add green chilies and cook for another minute. Serve hot.

fish.name: Sinigang na Bangus
ingredients: 1 pack sinigang mix or fresh tamarind extract
Salt and fish sauce to taste
procedure: Boil water in a pot. Add onion and tomatoes, then cook until softened.
Add the bangus and simmer until cooked.
Mix in the sinigang mix or tamarind extract. Stir well.
Add radish, eggplant, and green chilies. Simmer until vegetables are tender.
Toss in the kangkong and season with salt and fish sauce. Serve hot.

fish.name: Grilled Tilapia
ingredients: Banana leaves or aluminum foil for wrapping
procedure: Mix garlic, ginger, tomato, and onion. Season with salt and pepper.
Stuff the mixture into the fish's belly.
Wrap the fish in banana leaves or aluminum foil.
Grill over charcoal until both sides are cooked and slightly charred. Serve hot.

fish.name: Relyenong Bangus
procedure: Carefully remove the fish meat, keeping the skin intact.
Sauté garlic, onion, and tomato until softened. Add the fish meat and cook until done.
Mix in carrots, bell pepper, and beaten egg. Season with salt and pepper.
Stuff the mixture back into the fish skin.
Fry until golden brown on all sides. Serve hot.

fish.name: Ginataang Tulingan
procedure: Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until fragrant.
Add the tulingan and pour in the coconut milk. Simmer until the fish is tender.
Add green chilies and pechay or spinach leaves.
Pour in the coconut cream and simmer until sauce thickens.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

fish.name: Escabeche
ingredients: 1 whole fish (tilapia or lapu-lapu), cleaned and fried
procedure: Fry the fish until golden brown. Set aside.
In a pan, sauté garlic and onion until fragrant. Add bell pepper and carrot.
Mix vinegar, sugar, soy sauce, and water. Pour into the pan and bring to a boil.
Add pineapple chunks (if using) and season with salt and pepper.
Stir in cornstarch slurry to thicken the sauce.
Pour the sauce over the fried fish. Serve hot.

fish.name: Tinoyoang Tilapia
procedure: Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until fragrant.
Add tilapia and pour in soy sauce, vinegar, and water. Simmer until fish is cooked.
Stir in sugar and season with salt and pepper.
Simmer until sauce is slightly reduced. Serve hot.

fish.name: Sarciadong Tilapia
procedure: Sauté garlic, onion, and tomatoes until softened.
Pour in water and bring to a boil.
Add the fried tilapia and simmer for a few minutes.
Slowly pour beaten eggs while stirring gently.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

fish.name: Pinangat na Bisugo
procedure: Arrange fish in a pot. Add garlic, onion, and ginger.
Pour in vinegar and water. Season with salt and pepper.
Cover and simmer over low heat until fish is cooked.
Add green chilies and cook for another minute. Serve hot.

fish.name: Steamed Pompano
procedure: Stuff the fish with ginger, garlic, onion, and tomato.
Place the fish on a steaming plate.
Mix soy sauce, sesame oil, and oyster sauce, then pour over the fish.
Steam for about 20-25 minutes until the fish is cooked.
Garnish with spring onions and serve hot.

fish.name: Sinaing na Tulingan
ingredients: 1/2 cup dried kamias (or fresh if available)
procedure: Rub the fish with salt and let it sit for 30 minutes.
Wrap each fish in banana leaves and place them in a pot.
Add dried kamias, garlic, and ginger. Pour enough water to cover the fish.
Simmer over low heat until the fish is tender and water is almost evaporated.
Pour cooking oil and continue cooking until slightly toasted. Serve hot.

vegetable.name: Pakbet
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (okra, eggplant, ampalaya, sitaw, kalabasa)
procedure: Sauté garlic, onion, and tomatoes until softened.
Add bagoong alamang and stir well.
Mix in the vegetables and cook for a few minutes.
Pour water, cover, and simmer until vegetables are tender. Serve hot.

vegetable.name: Ginataang Kalabasa
ingredients: 1 bunch sitaw (string beans), cut into 2-inch pieces
procedure: Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add kalabasa and coconut milk. Simmer until tender.
Mix in sitaw and coconut cream. Cook until vegetables are done.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

vegetable.name: Chopsuey
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, cabbage, bell pepper, cauliflower, snow peas)
procedure: Sauté garlic and onion until softened.
Add chicken or pork and cook until browned.
Pour water or broth and bring to a boil.
Mix in vegetables and cook until tender-crisp.
Add oyster sauce, soy sauce, and season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot.

vegetable.name: Adobong Sitaw
ingredients: 1 bunch sitaw (string beans), cut into 2-inch pieces
procedure: Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add sitaw and stir-fry for a few minutes.
Pour soy sauce, vinegar, and water. Simmer until sitaw is tender.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

vegetable.name: Adobong Kangkong
procedure: Sauté garlic and onion until softened.
Add fried tofu and stir well.
Pour soy sauce, vinegar, and water. Simmer for a few minutes.
Mix in kangkong and cook until wilted.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

vegetable.name: Tortang Talong
procedure: Flatten roasted eggplants with a fork.
Dip each eggplant in beaten eggs.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the eggplants until golden brown on both sides.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

vegetable.name: Ginisang Pechay
procedure: Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add pechay and cook until slightly wilted.
Pour beaten eggs and stir gently until eggs are cooked.
Add water and simmer for a few minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

vegetable.name: Upo with Giniling
ingredients: 1 medium upo (bottle gourd), peeled and sliced
procedure: Sauté garlic, onion, and tomato until softened.
Add ground pork or beef and cook until browned.
Mix in upo and pour water. Simmer until tender.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

vegetable.name: Bulanglang na Saluyot
procedure: Sauté garlic, onion, and tomato until softened.
Add saluyot and stir-fry for a few minutes.
Pour water and simmer until tender.
Season with salt. Serve hot.

vegetable.name: Ensaladang Talbos
ingredients: 1 bunch talbos ng kamote (sweet potato leaves), blanched
procedure: Blanch talbos ng kamote in boiling water and drain.
Mix with tomato and onion in a bowl.
Drizzle vinegar and fish sauce.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve cold.

vegetable.name: Ginisang Munggo
procedure: Boil mung beans until soft, then set aside.
Sauté garlic, onion, and tomatoes in oil.
Add pork and cook until browned.
Mix in boiled mung beans and season with fish sauce.
Simmer until well combined. Add spinach or ampalaya leaves and cook until tender. Serve hot.

noodle.name: Sotanghon
procedure: Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add chicken and cook until lightly browned.
Pour chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Add sotanghon noodles, carrot, and cabbage. Simmer until noodles are tender.
Season with soy sauce, fish sauce, salt, and pepper. Serve hot.

noodle.name: Pancit Palabok
procedure: Sauté garlic and onion until softened.
Add ground pork and cook until browned.
Dissolve annatto powder in shrimp broth and pour into the pan.
Simmer until sauce thickens. Season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper.
Pour sauce over rice noodles.
Top with shrimp, chicharon, hard-boiled eggs, and spring onions. Serve hot.

noodle.name: Pancit Bihon
procedure: Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add chicken or pork and cook until browned.
Pour chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Add bihon noodles, carrot, and cabbage. Simmer until noodles are tender.
Season with soy sauce, oyster sauce, salt, and pepper. Serve hot.

noodle.name: Macaroni Sopas
procedure: Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add chicken and cook until lightly browned.
Pour chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Mix in macaroni and vegetables. Simmer until vegetables are tender.
Pour evaporated milk and stir well.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

noodle.name: Lomi
procedure: Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add pork or chicken and cook until browned.
Pour chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Add shrimp, carrot, and lomi noodles. Simmer until shrimp is cooked.
Pour beaten egg while stirring gently.
Thicken soup with cornstarch mixture.
Season with soy sauce, salt, and pepper. Serve hot.

noodle.name: Pancit Canton
procedure: Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add chicken or pork and cook until browned.
Pour chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Add pancit canton noodles, carrot, and cabbage. Simmer until noodles are tender.
Season with soy sauce, oyster sauce, salt, and pepper. Serve hot.

noodle.name: Pinoy Style Spaghetti
procedure: Sauté garlic and onion until softened.
Add ground pork or beef and cook until browned.
Mix in hotdogs and cook for a few minutes.
Pour tomato sauce and banana ketchup. Simmer until thickened.
Season with sugar, salt, and pepper.
Serve over spaghetti noodles and top with grated cheese.

noodle.name: Pinoy Carbonara
procedure: Fry bacon until crispy, then set aside.
Sauté garlic and onion in the same pan.
Add ham and cook for a few minutes.
Pour all-purpose cream and evaporated milk. Simmer until thickened.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve over spaghetti noodles, top with bacon and grated cheese.

noodle.name: Pancit Habhab
procedure: Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add pork and cook until browned.
Pour pork broth and bring to a boil.
Add miki noodles, carrot, and cabbage. Simmer until vegetables are tender.
Season with soy sauce, fish sauce, salt, and pepper. Serve hot.

noodle.name: Misua with Siomai
procedure: Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Pour chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Add misua noodles and cook until tender.
Pour beaten egg while stirring gently.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve with siomai on top.

beef.name: Bistek
procedure: Marinate beef in soy sauce, calamansi juice, and pepper for 30 minutes.
Sauté garlic until fragrant.
Fry beef until browned.
Add marinade and simmer until beef is tender.
Top with onion rings and cook until softened. Serve hot.

beef.name: Beef Tapa
procedure: Marinate beef in soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, garlic, and pepper overnight.
Fry marinated beef until browned.
Serve hot with rice and fried egg.

beef.name: Nilagang Baka
procedure: Boil beef shank with onion and peppercorns until tender.
Add corn and potatoes, and cook until soft.
Mix in cabbage and cook until tender.
Season with salt. Serve hot.

beef.name: Beef Kare-Kare
ingredients: 1 bunch string beans, cut into 2-inch lengths
procedure: Boil beef until tender. Set aside broth.
Sauté garlic and onion in annatto oil.
Add boiled beef and peanut butter, mixing well.
Pour beef broth and simmer until thickened.
Add vegetables and cook until tender.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with bagoong.

beef.name: Sinigang na Baka
procedure: Boil beef ribs with tomato and onion until tender.
Add radish, eggplant, and tamarind mix. Simmer until vegetables are cooked.
Mix in kangkong leaves and cook until wilted.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

beef.name: Papaitan
ingredients: 500g beef innards (tripe, liver, kidney), cleaned and sliced
procedure: Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until fragrant.
Add beef innards and cook until browned.
Pour vinegar and simmer for a few minutes.
Add water and cook until tender.
Mix in bile and simmer briefly.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

beef.name: Beef Sizzling
procedure: Sauté garlic and onion in butter until fragrant.
Add beef and cook until browned.
Mix in soy sauce and Worcestershire sauce. Simmer until thickened.
Serve hot with a fried egg on top.

beef.name: Beef Broccoli
procedure: Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add beef and cook until browned.
Mix in broccoli and stir-fry until tender.
Pour oyster sauce, soy sauce, and cornstarch mixture. Simmer until sauce thickens.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

beef.name: Beef Mechado
procedure: Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add beef and cook until browned.
Pour tomato sauce, beef broth, and soy sauce. Simmer until beef is tender.
Mix in potato and carrot. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

beef.name: Beef Pares
procedure: Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add beef and cook until browned.
Pour soy sauce, sugar, and beef broth. Add star anise. Simmer until beef is tender.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with rice and beef soup on the side.

seafood.name: Sinigang na Hipon
ingredients: 1 pack sinigang mix or fresh tamarind
Salt or fish sauce to taste
procedure: In a large pot, bring water to a boil and add the onion, tomatoes, and long green peppers.
Once the vegetables soften, add the shrimp.
Add the sinigang mix (or tamarind, if using), and cook for 5–10 minutes.
Add the eggplant, okra, and radishes, cooking until tender.
Season with salt or fish sauce. Add kangkong just before serving and cook briefly.

seafood.name: Squid Adobo
ingredients: 1 lb squid, cleaned and cut into rings
procedure: Heat oil in a pan and sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add the squid and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Pour in soy sauce, vinegar, and water. Add bay leaf and peppercorns.
Simmer for 5 minutes, then season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot.

seafood.name: Ginataang Alimango
procedure: Heat oil in a pan and sauté garlic, onion, and ginger.
Add crabs and cook for a few minutes.
Pour in coconut milk and water, then season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper.
Add green peppers and simmer for 10-15 minutes until the crabs are cooked and the sauce thickens.
Serve with steamed rice.

seafood.name: Ginataang Pusit
procedure: Heat oil in a pan and sauté garlic, onion, and ginger.
Add the squid and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add coconut milk, banana blossom, and fish sauce. Simmer until the squid is tender and the sauce thickens.
Season with salt and pepper, then serve hot.

seafood.name: Ginisang Tahong
procedure: Heat oil in a pan and sauté garlic and onion.
Add mussels and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Pour in Sprite and water, then simmer for 5-7 minutes.
Add fish sauce, salt, and pepper, then cook until the mussels open up.
Serve hot.

seafood.name: Garlic Butter Shrimp
procedure: In a large pan, melt butter and heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Add shrimp and cook for 3-5 minutes until pink.
Season with salt and pepper, then sprinkle with parsley before serving.

seafood.name: Okoy Alamang
procedure: In a bowl, mix rice flour, cornstarch, shrimp paste, egg, and water to make a batter.
Add shrimp and green onions, then season with salt and pepper.
Heat oil in a pan and drop spoonfuls of the mixture into the hot oil. Fry until golden and crispy.
Drain on paper towels and serve with vinegar dipping sauce.

seafood.name: Baked Scallops
ingredients: 1 lb scallops, cleaned and shells removed
procedure: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Arrange scallops on a baking sheet and drizzle with melted butter.
Sprinkle garlic, Parmesan, and parsley on top.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the scallops are cooked through and the topping is golden brown.
Serve with lemon wedges.

seafood.name: Camaron Rebosado
procedure: Mix flour, cornstarch, baking powder, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Add cold water and beaten egg to make a batter.
Dip shrimp into the batter and fry in hot oil until golden and crispy.
Drain on paper towels and serve with a dipping sauce (mayonnaise or sweet chili sauce).

seafood.name: Halabos na Hipon
procedure: Heat oil in a large pan and add shrimp. Cook for 2-3 minutes on each side.
Add salt and a little water, then cover to steam for 5 minutes.
Serve hot with dipping sauce (soy sauce with calamansi or vinegar).

dessert.name: Leche Flan
procedure: Caramelize sugar in a pan until golden brown and pour into molds.
Mix egg yolks, condensed milk, evaporated milk, and vanilla extract.
Strain the mixture and pour it into the molds over the caramelized sugar.
Steam for 30-40 minutes or until set. Cool and refrigerate before serving.

dessert.name: Halo-Halo
procedure: Layer sweetened fruits, beans, and nata de coco in a glass.
Add crushed ice and pour evaporated milk over it.
Top with ube halaya, leche flan, and ice cream.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

dessert.name: Turon
procedure: Coat banana slices in brown sugar.
Wrap each slice in a spring roll wrapper.
Fry until golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot.

dessert.name: Ginataang Pinipig
procedure: Boil coconut milk and sugar until thickened.
Add pinipig and cook until soft.
Mix in vanilla extract. Serve warm.

dessert.name: Ube Halaya
procedure: Cook purple yam in butter until soft.
Add condensed milk, evaporated milk, and vanilla extract.
Stir continuously until thick. Serve chilled.

dessert.name: Sapin-Sapin
procedure: Mix glutinous rice flour, coconut milk, sugar, and condensed milk. Divide the mixture into three parts.
Add ube flavoring to one part, jackfruit flavoring to another, and leave the third part plain.
Steam each layer one at a time until set.
Cool and slice. Serve the colorful dessert and enjoy!

dessert.name: Maja Blanca
procedure: Boil coconut milk, condensed milk, and sugar.
Add corn kernels and cornstarch mixture. Stir continuously until thickened.
Pour into molds and cool until set.
Serve chilled.

dessert.name: Buko Pandan
ingredients: 1 pack pandan-flavored gelatin, cooked and cubed
procedure: Mix shredded coconut, cubed pandan gelatin, condensed milk, and all-purpose cream in a bowl.
Chill in the refrigerator before serving.

dessert.name: Banana Con Yelo
procedure: Caramelize bananas with brown sugar until soft.
Serve with crushed ice and drizzle with evaporated milk.

dessert.name: Pichi-Pichi
procedure: Mix grated cassava, sugar, water, and pandan essence.
Pour into molds and steam until translucent.
Roll in grated coconut before serving.

dessert.name: Puto Bumbong
procedure: Mix rice flour with purple food coloring and mold into cylindrical shapes.
Steam the mixture on banana leaves until cooked.
Serve with butter, grated coconut, and muscovado sugar.
